parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofpr </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.90</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>

____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Activates and deactivates the engine of a vehicle. This command has to be executed where vehicle is [[local]]. 

NOTE: Executed on a remote vehicle this command may turn the engine on but then it will get turned off by itself after a short while. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> vehicle '''engineOn''' state </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> vehicle: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> state: [[Boolean]] - true to turn the engine on, false to turn it off </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[if]] (![[isEngineOn]] _jeep) [[then]] { _jeep [[engineOn]] [[true]]; };</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[waitUntil]] { [[player]] == [[driver]] _jeep; };
[[vehicle]] [[player]] [[engineOn]] [[true]];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[isEngineOn]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on August 25, 2014 - 22:27 (EST)
<dt class="note">[[User:Benargee|Benargee]]
<dd class="note">
To switch engine off can also use [[setFuel]] and [[fuel]]:
<code>[[private]] "_gas";
_gas = [[fuel]] heli;
heli [[setFuel]] 0;
[[sleep]] 0.01; 
heli [[setFuel]] _gas;</code>
Also sets helicopter fuel back to original quantity. Works on every other vehicle.

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
